citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A 5-year old female Shiba-Inu dog, identified #9220, is observed with non-weight bearing lameness of its left forelimb.
The dog is observed eating normally and navigating throughout its enclosure, but is unable to support weight on this limb
throughout the inspection. A facility representative stated the problem had been previously identified by the facility and
that it had improved during monitoring. The facility's written Program of Veterinary Care, however, does not provide
guidance for monitoring or managing such issues. The inspector confirmed with a facility representative and with a call to
the attending veterinarian that the veterinarian had not been notified. As lameness of this nature is a sign of significant
pain, failure to seek care or establishing guidance for addressing these issues may result in unnecessarily prolonged pain.
The facility must maintain appropriate methods of diagnosing and treating medical problems.
Correct by end of day, November 27, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A 5-year old female Shiba-Inu dog, identified #9220, is observed with non-weight bearing lameness of its left forelimb. 
The dog is observed eating normally and navigating throughout its enclosure, but is unable to support weight on this limb 
throughout the inspection. A facility representative stated the problem had been previously identified by the facility and 
that it had improved during monitoring. The facility's written Program of Veterinary Care, however, does not provide 
guidance for monitoring or managing such issues. The inspector confirmed with a facility representative and with a call to 
the attending veterinarian that the veterinarian had not been notified. As lameness of this nature is a sign of significant 
pain, failure to seek care or establishing guidance for addressing these issues may result in unnecessarily prolonged pain. 
The facility must maintain appropriate methods of diagnosing and treating medical problems.  
 
Correct by end of day, November 27, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
